title: Oscar winner Christoph Waltz failed to crack Hollywood as a young actor
text:
Oscar winner Christoph Waltz failed to crack Hollywood as a young actor Oscar winner Christoph Waltz failed to crack Hollywood as a young actor 
Press Association 2014 / / National Entertainment News Share 
Oscar winner Christoph Waltz tried to crack Hollywood as a young actor, but revealed he gave up after two years and went home. 
The star, who is now a global name, told Graham Norton: “When I was young I tried to crack America but after being a waiter for two years I decided it wasn’t for me and I went home. 
“I let the dream go and put it on the backburner. I was extremely frustrated.” Christoph Waltz (Matt Crossick/PA Wire/Press Association Images) 
He’s won two Academy Awards for roles in Quentin Tarantino movies, and said of the famed director: “He changed my life. He wrote the stuff that he offered me to win an Oscar with.” 
He can currently be seen as the villain in the latest James Bond instalment, Spectre. 
His Bond co-stars, Daniel Craig and Naomie Harris, and Bond theme singer Sam Smith were also guests on the show. 
Daniel, who has recently been quoted as saying he may not reprise the role, told Norton: “I’ll genuinely say that I have never done any job for the money. I can’t think about another one right at the moment because we have literally just finished this one. Now all I care about is getting the film in front of an audience. But, we’ll see.” Share article
